allHidden.description: The timeseries can be switch visible again in the legend by the icon on the right site.

empty.description: Click the “+”-button and select an option to select timeseries

chart.reachedMaxTimeperiod: The maximum selectable time period is exceeded and was adjusted.

diagram-export.no-data-hint: has no date in selected timeframe.
diagram-export.title: Title

empty.description:
To add a timeseries as a favorite, navigate to the diagram view and select the star symbol found in the timeseries details.
With the import Button you can reload previously exported favorites.
empty.header: No favorites have been added to the list

export.text: Here you can export your favorites. Just copy the JSON out of this textbox and save it in a file to import it later:

import.noValidJson: The JSON file is not valid!
import.override: Do you want to override your current favorites?
import.text: Here you can import your exported favorites. Just paste the JSON in this text field:

single.add: A new favorite '{label}' has been added to the list.
single.notSupported: The provider of the favorite '{0}' isn't supported and can't be loaded.

text.desktop: The chart view visualizes the data of all selected timeseries in within a certain time frame. The user can change the time frame, or the data values can be displayed in a table.
text.mobile: The chart view visualizes the data of all selected timeseries in within a certain time frame. The user can change the time frame, or the data values can be displayed in a table.

text.desktop: Here the user gets the list of all created favorites. The user can share his favorites list by an im- and export function between different devices.
text.mobile: Here the user gets the list of all created favorites. The user can share his favorites list by an im- and export function between different devices.

help.intro: This help page provides a short overview to all functions of this application:

text.desktop: The legend lists all selected timeseries. Besides additional information about the timeseries, the user can temporarlly hide the time series or change the styling of the timeseries. Additionally the timeseries can be added to the favorites or removed from the legend.
text.mobile: The legend lists all selected timeseries. Besides additional information about the timeseries, the user can temporarlly hide the time series or change the styling of the timeseries. Additionally the timeseries can be added to the favorites or removed from the legend.

text.desktop: With the list selection the user has the possibility to select time series based on different parameters (e.g. station name, observed property...).
text.mobile: With the list selection the user has the possibility to select time series based on different parameters (e.g. station name, observed property...).

text.desktop: All stations which offer timeseries are displayed on the map. The stations can be filtered based on a user selected measured parameter. When a station is selected, all timeseries including their measured phenomena are displayed in a list. The user can then select those timeseries which shall be displayed ad diagram or table.
text.mobile: All stations which offer timeseries are displayed on the map. The stations can be filtered based on a user selected measured parameter. When a station is selected, all timeseries including their measured phenomena are displayed in a list. The user can then select those timeseries which shall be displayed ad diagram or table.

text.desktop: Besides the language there are some further settings, which can be adjusted in this menu.
text.mobile: Besides the language there are some further settings, which can be adjusted in this menu.

text.desktop: The upper navigation bar is the main navigation bar. From here the users can access the diagram view, the timeseries selection and the favorites view.
text.mobile: The icons in the upper navigation bar lead to the settings, the help and the imprint. The bottom bar guides the user to the diagram, the selection of new timeseries or to the favorites view.

imprint.fundingAdditional: The development of this software version was funded by the BMBF in the special program "Geotechnologien" under the label 03G0854B.

entry.noDataWarning: No data available to the selected time frame

originalValues.active: Original values are used to display the data
originalValues.areDeactivated: The display of the original values is deactivated, because the selected time period is greater than a month.
originalValues.notActive: Generalized values are used to display the data
originalValues.notAllowed: To display original values limit the time period to less than a month.

clusterMarker.description: Info: While markers on the are close to each other, they will be grouped for a better overview.

lastValueMarker.description: Attention: some data provider are very slow.

permalink.clipboardInfo: Please copy the following link by yourself to clipboard:

reset.description: Attention: Your selected timeseries and favorites will be deleted permanently.

category.description: The available categories (such as waters or dams) are listed, by mouse click you can select a measuring station of a category and a measured phenomenon at this station (such as water level or precipitation). At the end you can add the selected timeseries to the diagram.

map.description: The available measuring stations are located on a map, after selecting a station you will see all available timeseries which can be displayed in the diagram view.

phenomenon.button: Show measured parameters and find timeseries
phenomenon.description: The available measured parameters (such as water level or precipitation) are listed, by mouse click you can select the category (such as raw data or validated data) and station of a phenomenon. At the end you can add the selected timeseries to the diagram.

station.description: The available stations are listed, by mouse click you can select the category (such as waters or dams) of a station and the phenomenon at the station (such as water level or precipitation). At the end you can add the selected timeseries to the diagram.

groupedAxis.description: Cluster or release a measured phenomenon (water level, humidity, pH-value, ...), with the same unit, to one or more y-axis.

zeroScaled.description: Sets or release a fixed, zero based axis scale.

warning.maxTimeRange: The time range can not be greater then one year
warning.startBeforeEnd: The start date can not be greater then the end date
